headline: Material sciences company Dow posts Q4 loss, says it's cutting 1,500 jobs, 4% of workforce
summary: Dow Inc.'s fourth-quarter profits came in well below Wall Street expectations and the material sciences company said Thursday that it is slashing 1,500 jobs globally in an effort to cut costs as sales stagnate.  Dow said the staff reductions are part of a broader plan to cut $1 billion in costs, citing “persistently weak macroeconomic conditions.”  Shares of Midland, Michigan-based Dow tumbled nearly 8% in morning trading.
